content.description: The diagram above represents the photoelectric effect for a metal. When the metal surface is exposed to light with increasing frequency and energy of photons, electrons first begin to be ejected from the metal when the energy of the photons is <math alttext="3.3 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Using the wavelength information provided above, what is the color of the light?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
